The study by Schilte et al . analyzed the effect of the disease on the quality of life of these patients after 36 weeks and associated limitations in regard to performing their usual activities. Concerning such limitations, 62.9% of patients reported difficulty in lifting themselves up from a sitting position; 54.8% had trouble walking; 54.8% experienced difficulty picking up objects; 53.2% had trouble opening bottles and other containers; and 37.1% reported having difficulty bathing. Suffering related to CHIKV infection is not limited to pain; a significant segment of patients presented with mental, mood, and sleep disorders. The disease also had an effect on emotional status, often leading to sleep disorders (56.4%), depression (50%), memory disorders (43.5%), and concentration disorders (38.7%)
